title: Zákon č. 272/2016 Z.z. o dôveryhodných službách pre elektronické transakcie
title_en: Act No. 272/2016 Coll. on Trust Services for Electronic Transactions on the Internal Market
description: Slovak implementation act for Regulation (EU) 910/2014 (eIDAS Regulation). Regulates electronic identification, trust services including electronic signatures, seals, time stamps, electronic delivery, and website authentication. Establishes the National Security Authority (NBÚ) as the supervisory body for trust services.

provisions.title: Subject matter
provisions.content: This Act regulates certain legal relations in connection with the directly applicable Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 July 2014 on electronic identification and trust services for electronic transactions in the internal market (eIDAS Regulation). This Act establishes the supervisory body for trust services and regulates the conditions for providing trust services in the Slovak Republic.

provisions.title: Scope
provisions.content: This Act applies to trust service providers established in the Slovak Republic and to electronic identification schemes notified by the Slovak Republic. This Act supplements Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 in the areas where the Regulation leaves the regulation to Member States. Where Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 directly applies, the provisions of this Act apply to the extent that they supplement or specify the provisions of the Regulation.

provisions.title: Definitions
provisions.content: For the purposes of this Act, the terms defined in Article 3 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall apply. In addition: (a) 'supervisory body' means the National Security Authority (Národný bezpečnostný úrad, NBÚ); (b) 'conformity assessment body' means a body accredited pursuant to Regulation (EC) No 765/2008 that performs conformity assessment of qualified trust service providers and the qualified trust services they provide; (c) 'national trusted list' means the list of qualified trust service providers and qualified trust services maintained by the supervisory body.

provisions.title: Supervisory body
provisions.content: The National Security Authority is the supervisory body for trust services pursuant to Article 17 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. The NBÚ shall supervise qualified trust service providers established in the Slovak Republic and the qualified trust services they provide to ensure compliance with the requirements laid down in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 and this Act.

provisions.title: Powers of the supervisory body
provisions.content: The NBÚ shall: (a) establish and maintain the national trusted list pursuant to Article 22 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014; (b) grant qualified status to trust service providers and the trust services they provide; (c) withdraw qualified status in case of non-compliance; (d) carry out audits of qualified trust service providers at least every 24 months; (e) cooperate with supervisory bodies of other Member States and with the European Commission.

provisions.title: Legal effects of electronic signatures
provisions.content: A qualified electronic signature pursuant to Article 25 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall have the equivalent legal effect of a handwritten signature. An advanced electronic signature based on a qualified certificate shall be presumed to have been created by the identified signatory. Public authorities shall accept qualified electronic signatures created in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 for the purpose of electronic submissions and electronic official communications.

provisions.title: Qualified electronic signature creation devices
provisions.content: Qualified electronic signature creation devices shall meet the requirements of Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. The NBÚ shall maintain a list of certified qualified electronic signature creation devices. A qualified electronic signature creation device shall ensure that the signatory can reliably protect the electronic signature creation data and that the electronic signature creation data used for signature creation can practically occur only once.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Electronic Seals and Time Stamps
provisions.title: Electronic seals
provisions.content: A qualified electronic seal pursuant to Article 35 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall enjoy the presumption of integrity of the data and of correctness of the origin of those data to which the qualified electronic seal is linked. Legal persons may use qualified electronic seals for ensuring the integrity and origin of documents and data.

provisions.chapter: Part Four – Electronic Seals and Time Stamps
provisions.title: Qualified electronic time stamps
provisions.content: A qualified electronic time stamp pursuant to Article 42 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall enjoy the presumption of the accuracy of the date and time it indicates and of the integrity of the data to which the date and time are bound. A qualified electronic time stamp shall be accepted as evidence in legal proceedings regarding the existence of certain data at a specific point in time.

provisions.chapter: Part Five – Electronic Delivery and Website Authentication
provisions.title: Qualified electronic registered delivery service
provisions.content: A qualified electronic registered delivery service pursuant to Article 44 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall enjoy the presumption of the integrity of the data, the sending of those data by the identified sender, and the receipt thereof by the identified addressee, and the accuracy of the date and time of sending and receipt. Electronic delivery through the central government electronic mailbox shall be deemed equivalent to postal delivery with return receipt.

provisions.chapter: Part Five – Electronic Delivery and Website Authentication
provisions.title: Website authentication certificates
provisions.content: Qualified certificates for website authentication pursuant to Article 45 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 shall identify the natural or legal person to whom the certificate was issued and enable the authentication of the website. Public authorities shall use qualified website authentication certificates for all public-facing official websites.

provisions.title: Electronic identification for public services
provisions.content: Access to online public services requiring electronic identification shall be provided through the national electronic identity card or through electronic identification means notified under Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. The Slovak Republic shall recognize electronic identification means issued under a notified electronic identification scheme of another Member State at an assurance level equal to or higher than that required for the online service in question.

provisions.title: National electronic identity card
provisions.content: The national electronic identity card with an activated electronic chip shall serve as an electronic identification means at the assurance level 'high' pursuant to Article 8 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. The electronic identity card shall contain qualified certificates for electronic signatures, enabling citizens to create qualified electronic signatures for electronic communication with public authorities.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Obligations of Trust Service Providers
provisions.title: Security requirements
provisions.content: Qualified trust service providers shall take appropriate technical and organizational measures to manage the risks posed to the security of the trust services they provide. Having regard to the latest technological developments, those measures shall ensure that the level of security is commensurate with the degree of risk. In particular, measures shall be taken to prevent and minimize the impact of security incidents and to inform stakeholders of the adverse effects of any such incidents.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Obligations of Trust Service Providers
provisions.title: Notification of security breaches
provisions.content: Qualified trust service providers shall notify the NBÚ of any breach of security or loss of integrity that has a significant impact on the trust service provided or on the personal data maintained therein. The notification shall be made without undue delay but in any event within 24 hours after the breach has been identified. Where the breach is likely to adversely affect a natural or legal person to whom the trusted service has been provided, the trust service provider shall also notify the affected person without undue delay.

provisions.chapter: Part Seven – Obligations of Trust Service Providers
provisions.title: Liability of trust service providers
provisions.content: A qualified trust service provider shall be liable for damage caused to any natural or legal person due to failure to comply with the obligations laid down in Regulation (EU) No 910/2014 and this Act. The burden of proof of the intention or negligence of a non-qualified trust service provider shall lie with the natural or legal person claiming the damage. The intention or negligence of a qualified trust service provider shall be presumed unless that trust service provider proves that the damage occurred without the provider's intention or negligence.

provisions.title: Administrative fines
provisions.content: The NBÚ may impose an administrative fine of up to EUR 100,000 on a qualified trust service provider for a breach of the obligations under this Act or Regulation (EU) No 910/2014. For serious or repeated breaches, the fine may be up to EUR 500,000. When deciding on the fine amount, the NBÚ shall take into account the gravity, duration and consequences of the breach, and whether the breach was intentional or negligent.

provisions.title: Withdrawal of qualified status
provisions.content: The NBÚ shall withdraw the qualified status of a trust service provider or a trust service where: (a) the provider or the service no longer meets the applicable requirements; (b) the provider has failed to remedy identified non-conformities within the period set by the NBÚ; (c) the provider's qualified certificate has been revoked. The NBÚ shall update the national trusted list upon withdrawal of qualified status.

definitions.definition: A trust service within the meaning of Article 3(16) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014, consisting of: (a) the creation, verification, and validation of electronic signatures, electronic seals, electronic time stamps, electronic registered delivery services, and certificates related to those services; or (b) the creation, verification and validation of certificates for website authentication; or (c) the preservation of electronic signatures, seals or certificates related to those services.

An advanced electronic signature that is created by a qualified electronic signature creation device, and which is based on a qualified certificate for electronic signatures, within the meaning of Article 3(12) of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.
The National Security Authority (Národný bezpečnostný úrad, NBÚ), acting as the supervisory body for trust services in the Slovak Republic pursuant to Article 17 of Regulation (EU) No 910/2014.
